thread.title: MLB community reacts to controversial Utley slide
thread.title_full: MLB community reacts to controversial Utley slide

author: app.com
title: MLB community reacts to controversial Utley slide
text:
MORE Chase Utley and the Dodgers added insult to injury to the Mets on Saturday night.
With the Mets clinging to a 2-1 lead in the seventh inning of Game 2 of the National League Division Series, Chase Utley broke up a potential double play with a hard, late slide at Ruben Tejada, who had already moved away from the bag as he tried to spin to complete the throw to first.
By breaking up the double play, the tying run came home. But because of the nature of the slide and Tejada's defenseless position, the Mets shortstop left the game with a fractured right fibula.
And after Tejada was carted off the field, the Dodgers challenged the ruling on the play and had the out overturned because Tejada's foot missed the bag. Utley was ruled safe, even though he himself had not touched the bag.
The Dodgers went on to win the game 5-3 and even the NLDS at 1-1, but discussion of the slide raged on in the social media universe long after the final out was recorded.
Here's a sampling of some of the reaction from the MLB community on Twitter.
